Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2018 08:02PM Careninnj wrote: hi eric. Just wanted to let your wife know shes not alone. Im 43. Diagnosed with IDC back in june. Had a double mastectomy in august. Im now cancer free! Btw im a jersey girl. You will all get through this. Its amazing how strong you will become. How much you can get through. Trust me.
Posts.Title: Wife recently diagnosed Eric235 DeeBB

Posts.Content: Careninnj wrote: I was diagnosed last week with IDC. They say its stage 1. Extremely small 7mm. Estrogen driven. No nodes are infected that they can see on ultrasound. I have an MRI next week to make sure its all good. But i have googled, checked this site and i have put myself into a complete panic. I keep reading statistics. And bad outcomes for woman that had stage 1. Co workers keep asking if i will need chemo, and inappropriate questions. I just want this to go away. I think about the cancer every nano secind of my day. I have lost weight cause i can't eat. Im just feeling very uneasy. Thank you for listening to me. Caren Dx 6/2018, DCIS/IDC, Right, <1cm, Stage IB, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 8/15/2018 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 11/25/2018 Prophylactic ovary removal Hormonal Therapy Arimidex (anastrozole) Surgery Mastectomy: Left, Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I cant do this. Careninnj Laurenrw

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2018 12:39PM Careninnj wrote: I really do try to stay off goggle. But its very hard. I am going to ask the doctor for meds. I wake up with a pounding heart every night thinking its a nightmare, but its not. Thank you all for your kind words. I will keep updating. My husband and i have a weekend trip planned for next weekend. My doctors said TO GO, im just worried i wont be able to have fun on it.
Posts.Title: I cant do this. Careninnj Laurenrw

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2018 04:27PM Careninnj wrote: thank you everyone for your encouragement. Today i had a bad day. I didnt eat anything all day. I reached out to a counselor at the hospital, shes been talking to me and helping. I have my MRI next thrusday. I let the bad thoughts take over, but not anymore. God will fullfill my days. And all the beautiful people on this sight. Caren

Posts.Title: KI-67 and Oncotype Scores - comparison Pyrrh Lisey

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2018 12:50PM - edited Aug 20, 2018 09:59PM by Careninnj i dont know if i can help. But im 4 days post op from my bilateral max with tissue expanders. To say i was nervous would be an understatement. I cried, panicked, threw stuff, everything leading up to surgery. I was scared of everything. The IV. The anesthesia. The needles. Pain. But most of all the sentinel node check to see if my cancer spread to the lymphs. The anticipation of it all is the worst! I asked god for a sign the morning of my surgery that everything would be ok. My mom passsed away from breast cancer over 20 years ago. When i got to the hospital my nurse comes to greet me and says " good morning caren, im your nurse eileen and were going to take care of you".eileen was my mothers name! At that point i felt a calmness i have never felt since my diagnosis. I knew i was going to be ok. And let me tell you. My recovery has been pretty darn good. Sure it hurts. But its surgery. Its going to hurt. But i. 4 days out now and im feeling so much better everyday. And as soon as i woke up my doc was there to say " your nodes were all clear!". You can do this. You will do this. And you wil live and be awesome.
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery at the end of August? dyna1883 dyna1883

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2018 06:30PM Careninnj wrote: i was diagnosed in june. Then tested for brca mutation..i came up brca2 +. So off they both went. I really had no choice. But i would do both at the same time. Why spend time worrying about the other breast? Just my opinion.
Posts.Title: Uni or double Samnjb MCBaker

Posts.Content: Careninnj wrote: i was diagnosed back in june with IDC. Found out lumpectomy was no longer on the table due to a brca2 mutation. Surgery is in 11 days. Im not crying anymore, i find myself becoming very angry. This morning i broke my dining room table and threw a glass frame at the wall and now my living room is covered in shattered glass. Nobody makes me feel better anymore. Not my kids, husband or friends. My xanax is noteven helping. I dont know what to do.
